title: How Many Calories in Whiskey?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in whiskey per standard shot, including alcohol content, zero carbs, and variations by proof or mixers for better tracking.
assumptions: 80-proof (40% ABV), 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) standard shot, straight with no mixers or ice dilution.
disclaimer: Calories vary by proof, brand, serving size, and any added mixers; distilled spirits have no nutritional labeling requirements.

quick_answer.text: A standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof whiskey contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Values reflect standard Nutrition Facts style; whiskey provides empty calories from ethanol.

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of whiskey?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for a 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof whiskey.

faqs.q: Does whiskey have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No—straight whiskey has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars; calories are purely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in whiskey?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories; each 10-proof increase adds ~12-15 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: Calories in whiskey vs. other spirits?
faqs.a: Similar to vodka or gin at same proof—around 97 kcal per 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof.

faqs.q: What about whiskey in a cocktail?
faqs.a: Mixers like soda or juice add 50-100+ kcal; stick to neat or water for lowest calories.
